channel.title: µDelta - a (very) tiny DeltaScape source
channel.description:
[center][size=14pt]Welcome to the official µDelta thread.[/size][/center] [center][size=10pt][b]Current size: 125KB, Version: 2 of 3.[/b][/size][/center]
With the EoC now here many people are quitting and joining private servers. [b]This week Jagex shut down 2 "Old School" servers.[/b] Alot of attention is being given to these old school servers. Delta is a great start if you plan to code a old school server, µDelta is even better! With it being smaller and cleaner than the original Delta this means it's just as fast!
µDelta has been in development for one week. In this time I managed to make it [b]five times smaller than the original Delta[/b], This means it's "[b]Super fast. Ultra light.[/b]". Version 1 of this source was never released but if you guys want it I can give it to you (250KB).[b] In Version 3 I plan to get µDelta down to 100KB![/b]
Picture's: [IMG]http://i46.tinypic.com/10zts0o.png[/img] [IMG]http://i49.tinypic.com/ji0qa9.png[/img]
Download µDelta: [b][URL=http://up.ht/WCl5zk]uDelta V2.rar - 134 KB[/URL][/b]

item.title: µDelta - a (very) tiny DeltaScape source
item.dc:creator: @cderty cderty
item.description:
@cderty wrote:

[quote=“vManlyMan, post:33, topic:481069”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=599307.msg4213202#msg4213202 date=1359862554]

µ always makes me think of the Möbius function. That’s my input on this thread.

µ actually stands for micro. It’s seen in electronics on some capacitors to show the µf (microfarads).
[/quote]

The lower-case letter mu (μ) is used as a special symbol in many academic fields. The upper case mu is not used, since it is normally identical to Latin M.
Mathematics

In mathematics:

the Möbius function in number theory
the integrating factor in ordinary differential equations
the population mean or expected value in probability and statistics
a measure in measure theory
minimalization in computability theory and Recursion theory
the learning rate as used in artificial neural networks
represents the mean in the Normal Distribution

This list cannot be exhaustive, since any Greek letter may be used freely as a variable name.
Measurement

In measurement:

the SI prefix micro-, which represents one millionth, or 10−6.
the micron, an old unit which corresponds to the micrometre (which is now denoted "µm")

Physics and engineering

In classical physics and engineering:

the coefficient of friction (also used in aviation as braking coefficient)
reduced mass in the two-body problem
linear density or mass per unit length in strings and other one-dimensional objects.
permeability in electromagnetism
the magnetic dipole moment of a current-carrying coil
dynamic viscosity in fluid mechanics
the amplification factor or voltage gain of a triode vacuum tube[1]
the electrical mobility of a charged particle
the airspeed relative to rotor tip speed (a.k.a rotor advance ratio), in rotorcraft

In particle physics:

the elementary particles called the muon and antimuon

In thermodynamics:

the chemical potential of a system or component of a system.

Computer Science

in Evolutionary Algorithm:

μ, population size from which in each generation λ offspring will generate. (the terms μ and λ originate from Evolution strategy notation)

Chemistry

In chemistry:

the prefix given in IUPAC nomenclature for a bridging ligand.

Pharmacology

In pharmacology:

an important opiate receptor

Orbital mechanics

In orbital mechanics:

Standard gravitational parameter of a celestial body, the product of the gravitational constant G and the mass M.
planetary discriminant, represents an experimental measure of the actual degree of cleanliness of the orbital zone, a criterion for defining a planet. µ is calculated by dividing the mass of the candidate body by the total mass of the other objects that share its orbital zone.

Music

Mu major chord
Electronic musician Mike Paradinas runs the label Planet Mu which utilizes the letter as its logo, and releases music under the pseudonym µ-Ziq, pronounced "music."

Software

In application names:

μTorrent, a BitTorrent client

Cameras

The Olympus Corporation manufactures a series of digital cameras called Olympus µ[mju:].[2] (Known as Olympus Stylus in North America.)
Linguistics

In phonology, it often stands for mora. In syntax, μP (mu phrase) can be used as the name for a functional projection.[3]

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mu_(letter)[/quote]

great post fag, totally relevant.

all you butthurts need to get over the fact this is a stupid thread, no need to repeat yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: µDelta - a (very) tiny DeltaScape source
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“strucker, post:34, topic:481069”] if (System.currentTimeMillis() - lastSave > 120000 && !inTrade) { savegame(false); // sM("Your profile has been automatically saved"); lastSave = System.currentTimeMillis(); }
why not save in process();
every 500ms?[/quote]

You should never load or save data within the logic loop, that is one of the worst mistakes that happened when people wrote servers.

Read full topic

The lower-case letter mu (μ) is used as a special symbol in many academic fields. The upper case mu is not used, since it is normally identical to Latin M.
Mathematics

In mathematics:

the population mean or expected value in probability and statistics
a measure in measure theory

This list cannot be exhaustive, since any Greek letter may be used freely as a variable name.
Measurement

In measurement:

the SI prefix micro-, which represents one millionth, or 10−6.
the micron, an old unit which corresponds to the micrometre (which is now denoted "µm")

Physics and engineering

In classical physics and engineering:

the coefficient of friction (also used in aviation as braking coefficient)
reduced mass in the two-body problem
linear density or mass per unit length in strings and other one-dimensional objects.
permeability in electromagnetism

the airspeed relative to rotor tip speed (a.k.a rotor advance ratio), in rotorcraft

In particle physics:

In thermodynamics:

Computer Science

in Evolutionary Algorithm:

μ, population size from which in each generation λ offspring will generate. (the terms μ and λ originate from Evolution strategy notation)

Chemistry

In chemistry:

the prefix given in IUPAC nomenclature for a bridging ligand.

Pharmacology

In pharmacology:

an important opiate receptor

Orbital mechanics

In orbital mechanics:

Standard gravitational parameter of a celestial body, the product of the gravitational constant G and the mass M.
planetary discriminant, represents an experimental measure of the actual degree of cleanliness of the orbital zone, a criterion for defining a planet. µ is calculated by dividing the mass of the candidate body by the total mass of the other objects that share its orbital zone.

Music

Mu major chord
Electronic musician Mike Paradinas runs the label Planet Mu which utilizes the letter as its logo, and releases music under the pseudonym µ-Ziq, pronounced "music."

Software

In application names:

μTorrent, a BitTorrent client

Cameras

The Olympus Corporation manufactures a series of digital cameras called Olympus µ[mju:].[2] (Known as Olympus Stylus in North America.)
Linguistics

In phonology, it often stands for mora. In syntax, μP (mu phrase) can be used as the name for a functional projection.[3]

en.wikipedia.org

Mu (letter)

Mu (uppercase Μ, lowercase μ; Ancient Greek μῦ [mŷː], Greek: μι or μυ -- both [mi]) is the 12th letter of the Greek alphabet. In the system of Greek numerals it has a value of 40. Mu was derived from the Egyptian hieroglyphic symbol for water (𓈖), which had been simplified by the Phoenicians and named after their word for water, to become 𐤌img (mem). Letters that arose from mu include the Roman M and the Cyrillic М. In Ancient Greek, the name of the letter was written μῦ and pronounced [mŷː].
